SEARCH
Module com.example.form
Package org.uwo.cs2212

Class CurrentUser

java.lang.Object
org.uwo.cs2212.CurrentUser
public class CurrentUser extends Object
This class is used to store data on the logged-in user. This includes their user generated POIs and their favourites
Author:
Yaopeng Xie, Jarrett Boersen

    • getCurrentUserLayerUrl

      public static URL getCurrentUserLayerUrl()
      This function allow the application to get the user's json file url
      Returns:
      The url of current user's json file

    • addPoi

      public static void addPoi(BaseMap baseMap, FloorMap floorMap, PointOfInterest poi)
      This method is used to add the POI data to the user layer
      Parameters:
      baseMap - The base map of the user layer
      floorMap - The floor map of the user layer
      poi - The poi will be added into the user layer

    • removeSelectedPOI

      public static void removeSelectedPOI()
      This method is used to remove the selected POI from the user layer

    • editPoi

      public static void editPoi(PointOfInterest updatedPOI)
      This method is used to update selected POI in the user layer
      Parameters:
      updatedPOI - The updated version of the POI (this is a new POI instead of editing the old one to allow searching for the old POI)

    • saveUserData

      public static boolean saveUserData()
      Saves the user data to a file, by calling the saveUserData method from the ConfigUtil class. The user data includes the list of favourite points of interest, which are extracted from the mapConfig object. The method also creates a new user layer file, if one does not already exist, and updates the current user layer URL accordingly. The method returns a boolean value indicating whether the user data was saved successfully or not.
      Returns:
      True if the user data was saved successfully, false otherwise

    • resetSessionData

      public static void resetSessionData()
      This method is used to reset thr user's session data (the userData list containing user created POIs and favourites)
